intro: Tagetes campanulata, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly rough texture. Its flowers are tubular at the base and expand into a rounded shape, resembling small bells, hence its common name. Tagetes campanulata is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional medicine.
